title: Nesprávné zobrazování některých stránek
content: Firefox ke vší své spokojenosti již používám po mnoho let. Mou spokojenost však ukončila jedna z aktualizací, ke které došlo ca před půl rokem. Stránky se mi od této doby zobrazují příliš velké. Běžnými způsoby (kupříkladu stiskem CTRL a -, či +) je odálit či přiblížit nelze. U většiny stránek se mění pouze velikost písma, velikost celé stránky však nikoliv. Pouze u některých stránek, kupříkladu Seznam.cz, lze tuto funkci využít zcela normálně. Též lišta záložek a lišta otevřených oken se po oné aktualizaci dosti zvětšily. Některé stránky, kupříkladu stránku mého internetového bankovnictví https://banking.creditas.cz/cb/, nemohu nyní ve Firefoxu vůbec využívat. Viz obrázky. Prvý obrázek nesprávně zobrazená stránka ve Firefox, druhý správné zobrazení v Microsoft Edge. Zkoušel jsem již vše možné, avšak stále si s tím nevím rady.
creator: ezob

title: Everytime Firefox and expressVPN running together, internet access is cut!
content:
Firefox / ExpressVPN ISSUE (21st Oct 2022)

My desktop computer's operating system is Windows 7 Ultimate with Microsoft Extended Software Updates (ESU). 1. The office software is Microsoft Office 2010, from which I use Outlook 2010 to send and receive emails. 2. The only browser that I use is Firefox. 3. With Express VPN to mask my IP address (Firefox browser extension for expressVPN enabled) 4. And my internet package provided by Avast Premium Security. Up until about a month ago, these 4 packages ran sweetly in the background protecting my computer from all devious activity. Then on return from a short break, I noticed that every time I switched on my computer and activated expressVPN, I could not access the internet or send/ receive any emails. I pay a yearly subscription to Avast Premium Care which offers a superb 24/7 service, where they can remotely connect to my computer and repair it whilst talking with me on the phone. Using their help, I quickly discovered that when Avast software was enabled when Firefox was running, I could access the internet and send emails. But when expressVPN was also running, I could not get internet access or send/ receive emails. Then it was by a process of elimination I proceeded to try and discover which package might be the culprit. With both Avast and expressVPN disconnected, Firefox works perfectly! But with Avast still disconnected, I switched on my VPN and instantaneously, the internet was cut off! It was then that I contacted expressVPN technical support for help. We changed every single expressVPN setting possible, to no avail! And considering that all the VPN in essence does is mask my computer's IP address, he concluded that the issue had to lie with a Firefox setting! I then proceeded to check I was running Firefox latest software, deleted all browser history and cache and changed the network settings to no proxy - to no avail! In desperation, I turn to your technical team to resolve this issue for me, as I have no idea what has happened!!! This system has worked for years without a hiccup. Now I'm at my wit's end and need my computer running flawlessly to continue my business work as a matter of the utmost urgency!
creator: nbloch

title: picture in picture won't stay maximized
content:
I'm having an issue in which the picture-in-picture pop-out won't stay maximized. It's been happening for a while. I will maximize it on one monitor while I work on another, and it will restore itself to the last size I had it periodically. Usually, if I don't maximize it again, it will change sizes again, a few seconds later, shrinking down to about a 480p sized window.

There's no rhyme or reason for when it happens. I could be in a different FF tab or window, or in a different program, or just sitting there not doing anything, and it can happen. Sometimes, it happens multiple times in a short period of time (just now, it restored itself 7 times in a row, less than 30 seconds apart). It never happens when the video is not playing, however.

This only started a couple months ago, but it got noticeably worse in the past week or so. Does anyone know why this might be happening?

Computer specs are: Windows 10, 10.0.19043, Intel core i5-7500 CPU, ASRock B250 Gaming K4 motherboard, 16GB RAM @ 2133Mhz, NVidia GeForce GTX 1070 GPU, Samsung SSD 860 EVO 1TB.

title: Why would an account (not mine) show up by itself on my Firefox browser when using Google maps?
content:
My email address is: abworldwide@icloud.com

I always use Firefox - last week opened Google Maps in Firefox- no problem - it worked fine - was in English - all good! This week - opened Google Maps - and all by itself there is an account of a person (not me) in Thai. I don't speak or understand Thai so I can't even try to get out of this persons account or eliminate it (not to mention - why is it there in the first place??? It just magically appeared???) By chance - I tried Google Maps in Safari (which I never use) - the account came up - NOT under this alien persons name - just regular Google Maps in English. I was able to utilize it - no problem.

This is extremely bizarre - I don't want to use Safari - but apparently Firefox has screwed up here (on it's own it has put this account into my machine - why?) - or possibly it's Google who screwed up which wouldn't be surprising. A person cannot contact Google - they are so arrogant they just have the attitude - we are Google - use our stuff - and the hell with you - nice!!! However - if Safari is just getting the regular Google Maps site - why is Firefox opening Google Maps in an alien account - like mentioned - I just went in like regularly and this alien account appeared.

I never use any of Googles services - I do have an OLD account there - but don’t even remember the user name or log-in. I don’t like their company - they are overbearing - dictatorial - and intrusive - so why bother with them. But no clue why this alien account would have been attached to my computer - not there one week - and then there the next out of the blue???

At any rate - is there any way to get rid of this alien account in my Firefox browser - I am not a computer wiz - but can follow instructions on how to do things easily. Maybe the Firefox cache needs to be cleared - I don’t know (?) - nor do I really know how to do that. Or why the cache would be storing information that shouldn’t be on my machine in the first place??? Thanks!

title: Some .MSI Files Downloaded as Garbled Plain/Text in Firefox v106.0.x
content:
I am trying to download a .msi installer from the Dell servers at https://dl.dell.com/serviceability/catalog/SupportAssistx64-3.12.3.5.msi using Firefox v106.0.1 but when I click on that link it opens in a new tab as garbled plain/text (see attached image). If I right click that link and choose "Save Link As" then I am able to correctly download the .msi file.

I have no problem downloading this .msi installer using MS Edge v106.0.1370.52.

I don't think there is a universal problem downloading all .msi installers with Firefox since I can download the latest 64-bit .msi installer for Firefox (Firefox Setup 106.0.1.msi) from https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/all/ without a problem.

I found a comment by jsche2000 in rkm's July 2017 thread clicking on msi link displays garbage rather than download msi file that "usually the problem is that the server is not set up with a specific content-type for .msi so it sends a default content type such as text/html or text/plain that Firefox dutifully displays in a tab... Unfortunately, there's no built-in way to tell Firefox 'when you see a .msi extension, ignore the content-type indicated by the server and just save it' ".

Before I contact Dell and ask them to fix this problem on their download server, is there any possibility that Firefox v106.0.x has introduced a bug in the way this browser recognizes the specific content-type of some .msi installers? I'm not sure, but there seems to be a change in way that Firefox downloads files in v106.0.x. For example, when I download the latest 64-bit .msi installer for Firefox from https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/all/ my Firefox prompt now specifically declares that I'm downloading a Windows Installer Package (see attached image), which I don't recall seeing with previous versions of Firefox. 

-----------

64-bit Win 10 Pro v21H2 build 19044.2130 * Firefox v106.0.1 * Microsoft Defender v4.18.2209.7-1.1.19700.3 * Malwarebytes Premium v4.5.16.217-1.0.1792 * Macrium Reflect Free v8.0.6979 * Dell SupportAssist v3.12.3.5 * Dell Update Windows Universal v4.6.0 Dell Inspiron 15 5584, Intel i5-8265U CPU, 8 GB RAM, 256 GB Toshiba KBG40ZNS256G NVMe SSD, Intel UHD Graphics 620

title: In new PDF edit mode, pen draws and scrolls at the same time
content:
Firefox 106 introduced 'Edit Mode' for PDF viewer, which includes a Draw mode.

Trying it with a Huion drawing tablet and pen, the pen scrolls at the same time as it draws, making it so I can only draw vertical lines.

Disabling Windows Ink feature in tablet settings prevents this, but then the drawing quality goes way down, making it a non-solution.

A possible viable solution would be a setting to stop Windows Ink devices from scrolling pages, is there such a thing?

Alternatively, this may be a bug. It makes little sense for one device to draw and scroll at the same time. A solution will be to fix it so enabling PDF Draw mode will disable scroll by touch gestures, so touch only draws instead.

I appreciate any help.

title: How to access Google Docs menu shortcuts / commands
content:
Greetings all I am a long time Chrome user trying to make the switch to Firefox. Mostly I love it, but one of my biggest roadblocks is Google Drive and Google Docs.

I'm very much a don't-take-your-hands-off-the-keyboard kind of guy and so I am heavily invested in the Google Docs menus and I have all the common menu commands memorized. (e.g., Alt-F, R to rename the current Google Doc.)

The problem on Firefox is that when I press Alt-F, I get the Firefox menu, not the Google Docs menu. So I have to resort to clicking the menu with the mouse instead of using the keyboard shortcut. Not the end of the world, but annoying.

Is there anyway to configure Firefox or Google Docs so I can use the Google Docs menus? Is there any sort of Add-on that would help with this?

Thanks Calvin Powers
creator: calvin.powers

title: Websites won’t load on desktop browser when there is a pending update
content:
I’m on Windows desktop, on a corporate machine, running Firefox browser. This is a problem I’ve noticed for quite awhile, one of those annoying things that happens enough that I notice it, but not enough to pursue an answer. Except it happened twice this week.

Occasionally Firefox will stop opening links. It will become where if I click a link from say an email, it will just hang there spinning on a new tab. If I open a tab, or use an existing tab, and type in an address, it will also keep spinning.

Every single time this happens, I’ve noticed there is a pending update in Firefox waiting for a restart. Once the browser is restarted everything starts acting normally again.

I do have a corporate VPN that I am usually connected to, I can’t remember if I’ve tried testing if that affects it or not. Each time it happens I restart the browser and go on my way. But wanted to report it now in case it’s something that can be tracked down and fixed. Thanks!

title: importing password csv

title: WebSSO Login Service
content:
A nem tudok a SIEMENS WebSSO Login Service -n keresztül belépni a belső hálózatba (név + jelszó) a 2022. 10 19 vagy 20.-i frissítés óta.

Hibajezés: "Siemens – Digital Industries – Web Single Sign On An error has occurred while processing your request. Please try again by going back to the original website and starting the login process again."

Ha újra próbálom, akkor a következő hiba jön: "Siemens – Digital Industries – Web Single Sign On An error occurred: ServletException "

Feltelepítettem a Google Chrohm-ot, azzal hibátlanul működik. Telepítettem a JAVA legújabb frissítését, a hiba ugyanúgy jelen van.

Üdv. SF

title: Błąd w ustawieniach aplikacji w przeglądarce Firefox
content:
Dzień dobry,

Piszę do Państwa z zapytaniem dotyczącym błędu spotykanego w naszej organizacji w aplikacji przeglądarki Firefox w różnych wersjach od 90+ do 101. Problem opiera się o zakładkę aplikację w ustawieniach ogólnych przeglądarki. W organizacji posiadamy pewną wtyczkę (EZD Addin) i przeglądarka w pierwszej chwili działa z nią prawidłowo wskazując jej lokalizację. Problem pojawia się po jakimś czasie, kiedy wtyczka przestaje działać a rozwiązaniem okazuje się ponowne wskazanie ścieżki do aplikacji.

Chciałbym zatem dowiedzieć się, czy problem nie jest przypadkiem po Państwa stronie i przeglądarka FF po jakimś czasie niejako wpływa na ustawienia w sekcji Aplikacji z ustawień ogólnych przeglądarki. Czy może wysyłają Państwo jakieś dodatkowe pakiety modernizujące przeglądarkę a jednocześnie wpływa to na ustawienia tej sekcji.

Odgórnie chciałbym zaznaczyć, że wykluczono z opcji błędów poprawki systemu Windows (nie pojawiały się w tym czasie), błędy wtyczki - wszędzie działa prawidłowo z wyjątkiem sytuacji opisanymi tutaj (było ich kilka na różnych stanowiskach).

Pozdrawiam Dominik Buksiński Gdańskie Centrum Informatyczne Proszę o rzetelne rozpatrzenie naszego zgłoszenia
creator: dominik.buksinski

title: Speedtest più lento con Firefox rispetto ad altri browser
content:
Buongiorno a tutti da quando sono passato alla fibra riscontro che nel fare gli speedtest Firefox raggiunge massimo i 350/380 Mbps mentre altri browser (Chrome e Edge) raggiungono i 900 Mbps.

Il problema lo riscontro a parità di server di test e anche con diversi test (Speedofme, ookla, fast, misurainternet).

Capita sia sotto Windows che sotto Ubuntu e con quest'ultimo se utilizzo speedtest cli la velocità raggiunta è effettivamente di 900 Mbps quindi direi che l'inghippo è proprio in Firefox: avete idee? A nessun'altro capita?

Grazie
